text: == Events == * February 10 – French and Indian War: The 1763 Treaty of Paris ends the war and France cedes Canada to Great Britain. * 15 February – the Treaty of Hubertusburg puts an end to the Seven Years' War between Prussia and Austria and their allies * March 1 – Charles Townshend becomes President of the Board of Trade in the British government * May 7 – Chief Pontiac begins the "Conspiracy of Pontiac" by attacking British forces at Fort Detroit. * June 2 – Pontiac's Rebellion: At what is now Mackinaw City, Michigan, Chippewas capture Fort Michilimackinac by diverting the garrison's attention with a game of lacrosse, then chasing a ball into the fort. * June 28 – earthquake in Komarom, Hungary * August 5 – Pontiac's War – Battle of Bushy Run – British forces led by Henry Bouquet defeat Chief Pontiac's Native Americans at Bushy Run in the Pennsylvania backcountry. * The Treaty of Paris signed by Great Britain, France and Spain brings an end to the Seven Years' War (also called the French and Indian War in the United States) * First publication of Bayes' theorem * Proclamation of 1763 nv:1751 – 1800
